def is_palindrome(text: str):

    """
    # code borrowed from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5252325/how-to-determine-if-a-string-is-a-palindrome-in-python
    # python's built in function len() returns the number of characters
    # in the string, which is not the length of the reversed string.
    length = len(text)
    start = 0
    end = length
    while end > start:
        # the loop that checks for palindrome
        while end - start > 0:
            # returns the index of a palindrome
            index = start
            while index < end:
                # checks the character at the index
                if text[start] == text[index]:
                    # the loop is over
                    break
                else:
                    # check if the character is another one
                    if text[start]!= text[index - 1:] or text[index - 1]!= text[index + 1:]:
                        # the character is not the other one
                        break
                # the loop increments
                start = index + 1
            # the loop increments
            end = start + 1
        # the loop increments
        start = end - 1
    # if there is no palindrome, the code returns True
    return (end == length)
